The sum of the values of an odd function is 0.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_3} {β : Type u_4} [inst : AddCommGroup β] [inst_1 : NoZeroSMulDivisors ℕ β] [inst_2 : Fintype α]
  [inst_3 : InvolutiveNeg α] {f : α → β}, Function.Odd f → ∑ a : α, f a = 0
name: Function.Odd.sum_eq_zero
docString: The sum of the values of an odd function is 0.

The sum of two integers is even if and only if both integers are even.

type: ∀ {n : ℤ}, Even n = (n % 2 = 0)
name: Mathlib.Data.Int.Parity._auxLemma.21
docString: The sum of two integers is even if and only if both integers are even.

This theorem states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, the sum `m + n` is even if and only if `m` and `n` are both even or both odd. In other words, the parity of the sum of two natural numbers is the same as the parity of the individual numbers. Here, `Even` is a property of a number that is defined to be true if the number can be expressed as the sum of two equal numbers.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Even (m + n) ↔ (Even m ↔ Even n)
name: Nat.even_add
docString: This theorem states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, the sum `m + n` is even if and only if `m` and `n` are both even or both odd. In other words, the parity of the sum of two natural numbers is the same as the parity of the individual numbers. Here, `Even` is a property of a number that is defined to be true if the number can be expressed as the sum of two equal numbers.

The convolution of two even functions is also even.

type:
∀ {�� : Type u��} {G : Type uG} {E : Type uE} {E' : Type uE'} {F : Type uF} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E]
  [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E'] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] {f : G → E} {g : G → E'} {x : G}
  [inst_3 : NontriviallyNormedField ��] [inst_4 : NormedSpace �� E] [inst_5 : NormedSpace �� E'] [inst_6 : NormedSpace �� F]
  (L : E →L[��] E' →L[��] F) [inst_7 : MeasurableSpace G] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure G} [inst_8 : NormedSpace ℝ F]
  [inst_9 : AddCommGroup G] [inst_10 : μ.IsAddLeftInvariant] [inst_11 : μ.IsNegInvariant] [inst_12 : MeasurableNeg G]
  [inst_13 : MeasurableAdd G],
  (∀ᵐ (x : G) ∂μ, f (-x) = f x) →
    (∀ᵐ (x : G) ∂μ, g (-x) = g x) → MeasureTheory.convolution f g L μ (-x) = MeasureTheory.convolution f g L μ x
name: MeasureTheory.convolution_neg_of_neg_eq
docString: The convolution of two even functions is also even.

The sum of two natural numbers is even if and only if both numbers are even or both are odd.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Even (m + n) ↔ (Even m ↔ Even n)
name: Nat.even_add
docString: The sum of two natural numbers is even if and only if both numbers are even or both are odd.

The theorem `Even.mod_even` states that for any two natural numbers `n` and `a`, if both `n` and `a` are even (i.e., each can be expressed as twice some other natural number), then the remainder when `n` is divided by `a` is also even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even n → Even a → Even (n % a)
name: Even.mod_even
docString: The theorem `Even.mod_even` states that for any two natural numbers `n` and `a`, if both `n` and `a` are even (i.e., each can be expressed as twice some other natural number), then the remainder when `n` is divided by `a` is also even.

If `n` is even and `a` is even, then `n % a` is even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even n → Even a → Even (n % a)
name: Even.mod_even
docString: If `n` is even and `a` is even, then `n % a` is even.

If `a` is even, then `n` is even iff `n % a` is even.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Even (n % a) ↔ Even n)
name: Even.mod_even_iff
docString: If `a` is even, then `n` is even iff `n % a` is even.

If `a` is even, then `n` is odd iff `n % a` is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Even a → (Odd (n % a) ↔ Odd n)
name: Odd.mod_even_iff
docString: If `a` is even, then `n` is odd iff `n % a` is odd.

If `n` is odd and `a` is even, then `n % a` is odd.

type: ∀ {n a : ℕ}, Odd n → Even a → Odd (n % a)
name: Odd.mod_even
docString: If `n` is odd and `a` is even, then `n % a` is odd.

Any constant function is even.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : Neg α] (b : β), Function.Even fun x => b
name: Function.Even.const
docString: Any constant function is even.

If `f` is even and `g` is odd, then `f ∘ g` is even.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : Neg α] {γ : Type u_3} [inst_1 : Neg β] {f : β → γ},
  Function.Even f → ∀ {g : α → β}, Function.Odd g → Function.Even (f ∘ g)
name: Function.Even.comp_odd
docString: If `f` is even and `g` is odd, then `f ∘ g` is even.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

name: Nat.dvd_right_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication.

type: ∀ {a b x y u v : ℕ}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 → b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 → ∃ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2
name: Nat.sq_add_sq_mul
docString: The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication.

The sum of two squares is zero iff both elements are zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Semiring α] [inst_1 : LinearOrder α] {a b : α} [inst_2 : IsRightCancelAdd α]
  [inst_3 : NoZeroDivisors α] [inst_4 : ZeroLEOneClass α] [inst_5 : ExistsAddOfLE α] [inst_6 : PosMulMono α]
  [inst_7 : AddLeftMono α] [inst_8 : AddLeftStrictMono α], a * a + b * b = 0 ↔ a = 0 ∧ b = 0
name: mul_self_add_mul_self_eq_zero
docString: The sum of two squares is zero iff both elements are zero.

In `Fin n`, all elements are even for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is even iff its `Fin.val` value is even.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} {k : Fin n}, Even k ↔ Odd n ∨ Even ↑k
name: Fin.even_iff
docString:
In `Fin n`, all elements are even for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is even iff its `Fin.val` value is even.

If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

type: ∀ {m n : ℕ}, Even (m ^ n) ↔ Even m ∧ n ≠ 0
name: Nat.even_pow
docString:
If `m` and `n` are natural numbers, then the natural number `m^n` is even
if and only if `m` is even and `n` is positive.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.evenOddStrongRec

In `Fin n`, all elements are odd for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is odd iff its `Fin.val` value is odd.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} [inst : NeZero n] {k : Fin n}, Odd k ↔ Odd n ∨ Odd ↑k
name: Fin.odd_iff
docString:
In `Fin n`, all elements are odd for odd `n`,
otherwise an element is odd iff its `Fin.val` value is odd.

Two algebra morphisms from the even subalgebra are equal if they agree on pairs of generators.

See note [partially-applied ext lemmas].

type:
∀ {R : Type uR} {M : Type uM} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] [inst_2 : Module R M]
  (Q : QuadraticForm R M) {A : Type uA} [inst_3 : Ring A] [inst_4 : Algebra R A]
  ⦃f g : ↥(CliffordAlgebra.even Q) →ₐ[R] A⦄,
  (CliffordAlgebra.even.ι Q).compr₂ f = (CliffordAlgebra.even.ι Q).compr₂ g → f = g
name: CliffordAlgebra.even.algHom_ext
docString:
Two algebra morphisms from the even subalgebra are equal if they agree on pairs of generators.

See note [partially-applied ext lemmas].

A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`

The sum of two elements of an additive subsemigroup belongs to the subsemigroup.

type:
∀ {M : Type u_3} [inst : Add M] (self : AddSubsemigroup M) {a b : M},
  a ∈ self.carrier → b ∈ self.carrier → a + b ∈ self.carrier
name: AddSubsemigroup.add_mem'
docString: The sum of two elements of an additive subsemigroup belongs to the subsemigroup.

If `f` is arbitrary and `g` is even, then `f ∘ g` is even.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : Neg α] {γ : Type u_3} {g : α → β},
  Function.Even g → ∀ (f : β → γ), Function.Even (f ∘ g)
name: Function.Even.left_comp
docString: If `f` is arbitrary and `g` is even, then `f ∘ g` is even.
